page.title: 01HELSTON TODAY
page.content:
{Helston}climbs the slopes of the { {Cober Valley}and is situated in the south-west of {Cornwall}.It has a population of about 10,000 people. The quaint old market town is surrounded by lush green fields and farms, many of these still owned by the great grandchildren of the original owners.
The older buildings of the town are built of {granite}whilst the more modern buildings lack character being built from modern material available throughout the country.
{ Helston}is a very old town and originated from the old Celtic Court of {Henlys}. Later it became the Saxon manor of {Henlyston,}which in turn became known as the town of Helston. It received its first charter from King John in 1201.
